Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay from Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: inspector12
Reviews.Content: Held over in Phoenix for a day and needed a place to say before my next flight. I had stayed at other Hilton group Phoenix airport (PHX) properties before, but not the Hilton Phoenix Airport. Very pleasant surprise! I phoned the hotel from the arrivals level. They told me exactly where to go, gave me an estimated shuttle arrival time, and actually appeared at the pickup point at the time they said they would. The shuttle driver was very friendly. He helped all passengers with their bags. A pleasant shuttle driver goes a long way toward setting the tone for a pleasant hotel stay. Check-in was pleasant and efficient. The Hilton Phoenix Airport has a Hilton Honors level floor with a twenty-four hour lounge with breakfast and evening snack service for Hilton Honors members. The evening service hostess was very pleasant and the snack service was enough for a meal. And since the lounge is open 24 hours, it is possible to stop back in and pick up a beverage. The pool area was very clean. Towels were available. Room was comfortable and well appointed. Many guests were present in the morning to shuttle to the airport. Staff saw the number, quickly found a second driver, and got us all under way in two vans! This was a very welcome stress free and perfect hotel stay from start to finish. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport property”
Reviews.Author: cfischer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the PHX airport Hilton on our way to the National Parks in AZ and UT for 1 night, after getting in on a late evening flight. Having stayed at many airport properties, my expectations were quite low, especially since we only paid $65 on a pre-pay rate. After getting our rental car, we arrived at the hotel after midnight and were warmly greeted by the front desk agent. After giving us the room card for our upgraded oversized room on the 4th floor, he went ahead and got us a few bottles of water from the back (nice touch!). Our room was on the 4th floor and turned out to be very spacious, featuring bright colors and modern design. To our surprise the executive lounge was open 24-7 and we were able to get soft drinks even at 1 a.m. in the morning! The hotel itself was very quiet and there was no noise from the airport at all. Next morning we had breakfast in the lounge, which was quite good and I was able to use the computer in the lounge to check in for our next hotel. They also gave us 2 $2 coupons for a discount, in case we wanted a full breakfast in the restaurant, which I thought was a really good idea. The lounge breakfast was good enough for us and after a quick check out we were on our way to the National Parks. Overall the hotel exceeded our expectations. Service was great and the room was great. Right now I am in the process of changing some of my future bookings, because I will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve E
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a family of 4 with 2 teenagers ... finishing up a week of SW travel and needed an overnite hotel in Phoenix for an early morning flight. Perfect choice - good location, attentive service / check-in with a good recommendation for a local Mexican restaurant and comfortable and clean rooms ... all at a good price. Plus plus for us was ability to drop off our Hertz rental at the hotel rather than dealing with airport dropoff. Shuttle service to the airport the next morning was an efficient 5-10 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel right at the airport. Very nice and a clean safe location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly long hallways!”
Reviews.Author: MattArmb9
Reviews.Content: My stay here was very good. It is convenient to the airport and the service was good, but the thing I remember most is taking 10 minutes to get to my room at the end of the hallway (exaggeration obviously). The hotel is short and therefore very spread out. Breakfast buffet was very good and wait staff was really hopping. Excellent work out facility.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wtlftdoc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great choice for business or if you are catching a flight into or out of Sky Harbor. We stayed here twice in 10 days (leaving for, and coming back from, a trip). The rooms are comfortable with good amenities and nice balconies. Although the pool area is small, it is adequate for most needs. The strength of the hotel comes from its staff. Everyone was very pleasant and seemed generally happy that we were there. One downside is its proximity to the airport. If you are a light sleeper, the planes will get you up bright and early. The breakfast buffet is great if you like a hearty meal!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay near airport.”
Reviews.Author: morgan88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the airport and offers free transportation. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable. I ordered room service one evening and the waiter was outstanding (wish I would have gotten his name). The only con's: there is nothing within walking distance, nor would you want to take a walk anywhere in this neighborhood. A bit dicey with strip joints a few blocks away. Also, all the room doors SLAM when they close, which causes light sleepers like me to wake up all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a late night arrival”
Reviews.Author: z75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was close to the airport. We were not arriving until 10:00 p.m. so I didn't want to have to go far that night. The staff was extremely friendly and the service was great. The breakfast buffet was yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kim C
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the airport around 7:00 pm on Friday, March 16th, and called for a hotel shuttle. Shuttle arrived within 15 minutes. The shuttle driver was awesome. Very friendly and accommodating. We told him of our need for a taxi the following morning at 4:30 am and he took care of everything. Check in was a breeze. The young lady working the desk was very pleasant as well. The room was very well appointed and clean. We ordered food to our room from Rosaria's Pizza and it was awesome as well. It did take an hour for delivery but well worth the wait. I would highly recommend this hotel. Unfortunately I'm not able to comment on anything else since we were only there from 7:00 pm to 4:30 am.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: JustMe1950
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and the staff was awesome. From the front desk, bell staff, housekeeping, restaurant, everyone. Hotel shuttle to the airport was fast. I highly recommend this location for any conference your business may need.

Reviews.Title: “An aging property”
Reviews.Author: capjessop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for several nights while in town for spring training. I got the hotel by naming my own price on Priceline for $55 a night + tax. If you've ever done the priceline thing, you know what to expect. It's the worst hotel in the category I searched, which was the airport region 3+ stars. That's not to say it was a bad hotel. Its obviously an older property. The room was smallish, the bathroom was truly small, and there were signs of age (water warped bathroom door, tiny amounts of mildew in corners you cant get to, etc.) But my worst complaint was the AC. I like it cold, and granted it was spring, but it wouldn't get much colder than 75 degrees, and imagine in the hot summer desert sun it would be much worse. We had a king room with a sofa bed, on the first floor, facing the courtyard. The room had a sliding glass door, and a small patio where we could see the pool. That was by far the best perk. The hotel is quite near the airport, and fairly central (10 min to Tempe, downtown, Scottsdale and many spring training ballparks). Overall, I'd say it was worth aprrox. 85 dollars a night. There must be better alternatives in a similar class to a Hilton if you're going to spend more than that. There is also an excellent breakfast restaurant about a mile down University from the hotel called Harlow's Cafe. Go Rockies!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, not bad”
Reviews.Author: LA_editor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. I most liked that the balcony was sealed in so that my one year old could safely walk out there alone if he wanted. The upper part of the balcony was open but the bottom half was a solid wall. The bathroom was small. I had to shut the door in order to get into the shower. The pillows were ridiculous. They looked nice and fluffy but once I put my head down, all of the air squished out and my head was pretty much on the bed and the sides of the pillow bubbled up to mimic ear muffs. I had to use three pillows to try to get my head off of the bed. The king sized bed didn't seem very big and the white comforter had a blood stain on it, which was obviously disgusting! The hotel staff was very friendly and they even put a mini-fridge in our room (free of charge) for the baby's milk. The concierge room was very nice with wonderful snacks. Minus the grossness of the room, our stay wasn't bad at all. The rooms were spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RB19
Reviews.Content: This is what you'd expect from a Hilton. Friendly staff, clean rooms, and comfortable beds. I had no problems during my stay. It's also nice to have a free shuttle from the airport. Breakfast in the club lounge was very good. They had a nice variety of stuff including cereal, fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, etc. Definitely one of the better Hilton club lounges I've experienced. The only real problem with this hotel is the location. You'd probably need a car to get anywhere, but it's great if you just need an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: A L
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night in March 2012. Booked through Expedia.ca The room was as booked at reservation and staff was nice enough to recognize how tired I was and offered assistance and a bottle of water upon check-in. Check-out was just as quick and easy. The rooms and hotel is dated, I'd say later 1990s but the beds were heavenly and that's what counts.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was friendly and rooms were clean”
Reviews.Author: CampK9
Reviews.Content: I thought that the facility was good for the purpose of my travel. Room was clean. Bed was comfortable. Thought it would be noisey with the airport next door, but was suprisingly quiet. Great highway access to get to most places in the southern area of Phoenix. Don't stray to far from the property for it changes quickly, but found the ammediate area was safe and secure. The hotel dinning was suprisingly good.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNesterMom
Reviews.Content: Although public areas are attractive, rooms in this property were not up to my expectations for a Hilton. Lobby and pool area are very attractive, exercise room was very good with multiple treadmills, bikes and ellipticals as well as free weights and a couple of weight machines. All machines did fill up during busy morning hours, and one day there was no water in the water cooler. Restaurant and bar were acceptable with good service and good beer and wine choices but unexciting food. Towels, shower and toiletries were very nice, bed and pillows adequate, desk area ample. There was a small sofa/loveseat and coffee table in the room, which is convenient; they just didn't appear to be new or fresh. But no refrigerator and no free breakfast, and the earliest room service delivery time was a fairly wide ranging 6:30-7:00am - not helpful for if you need to get going early to work or the airport. Breakfast was available in the restaurant, and my traveling companions said it was good, but that means being dressed and ready to sit down and wait for as long as it takes to order and be served. There are no restaurants within easy walking distance or short driving distance (as far as I, a stranger to the area, could tell.) There was nothing specifically wrong with this hotel, but nothing that made it stand out in a positive way either.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dc888traveller
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, I booked a room here by accident, thinking that I was reserving room in another Hilton chain hotel. I was a bit worried when I read some of the reviews here, and so I was pleasantly surprised that I had as comfortable a stay as I did. These were some of the highlights: always number one for me is a clean room, which it was. The bed was quite comfortable, and the room had a desk, sofa, safe, and well kept-up bath. There was a dual-cup coffee maker. A new wi-fi access was being installed while I was there. Before it was completely upgraded, the peak-time speeds were a bit slow. (The hotel should drop the $9.95/day charge for the service.) The bathroom had the usual amenities, but the service was a bit stingy with facial tissue. The staff was invariably polite and helpful. I can't say enough great things about them. I didn't eat in the restaurant, so I can't comment on that. Some reviews point out the infelicitous location. It's near the airport, which has its convenience; I wasn't bothered by airplane noise. There really isn't anything to walk to in the area; you probably want to stay in Scottsdale if being close to nightlife is important to you. Other reviewers point to the sleazy strip clubs, but those facilities are down the main road (University) from the hotel. They are by no means in visual proximity to the hotel. You might want to ask where your room is located with respect to the lobby. My room was about as far from the lobby as it could be--and in this poorly designed building, that was a long ways. I joked that I had to start out 30 minutes before everyone else. All in all, it was a fine place to stay, with warm hospitality and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: diamosd
Reviews.Content: Not one of the most upscale Hilton's but certainly not near the bottom of the dated Hilton brand. Great location and great night's rest. Very convenient to airport. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great night’s sleep in the clean, modern well-appointed, quiet room with a comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Gershwin12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with Priceline and received an excellent rate for a clean, comfortable, and convenient to airport hotel room. Our arrival to Phoenix airport was late in the evening; we received a friendly greeting upon check in. The bar adjacent to the lobby is lively. The heated pool and hot tub, luckily for us is open 24 hours; it was a cool evening and the pool and hot tub were the perfect temperature and was so delightful after a long flight. The airport is about a 5 minute drive. Parking is free, or if not driving there is a free shuttle to and from the airport that runs every half an hour. We called the hotel upon arrival and the shuttle arrived within 5 minutes. Great night’s sleep in the clean, modern well-appointed, quiet room with a comfortable bed, coffee maker with LavAzza coffee and real half and half. No complimentary breakfast, restaurant and room service available. We were given $2 off coupons for breakfast, but did not eat at the restaurant. We ate breakfast at Harlow’s Café on University drive, 5 minute drive, great huevos rancheros. We stayed only one night, so cannot comment on all amenities offered by hotel. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again when a Phoenix airport is required.

Reviews.Title: “I'm getting old but my hotel room can be renovated”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: I guess I was put here by my agent because I have Hilton status and it is convenient to the airport. But as Hilton properties go, this one needs an overhaul. The room and carpet are old, tired. The furniture was also dated, although the TV was decent. There are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again...”
Reviews.Author: rlamond
Reviews.Content: As a Gold Member got a very nice room on the concierge floor for one night. Inside room with a nice view overlooking the pool area. Concierge lounge for breakfast in the morning and heavy snacks in the evening exceeded expectations. Had a drink at the bar and it was a nice place to gather (as many already had) and wind down. Con? Prices in the shop for a tube of toothpaste and a pack of gum were over the top but I knew that before I walked in...

Reviews.Title: “Clean but average”
Reviews.Author: travellerSunnySouth
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, courteous, welcoming and professional. My only complaint is that this was a business trip and we could not get Wifi. Come on guys... this is 2011/2012. I am finding this at a few of the Hilton brand hotels .... having to either pay for Wifi or the Wifi is not working. In this instance, I had to call the front office on 3 occasions to get a connection to my room. They in turn had to contact their computer guy to rectify the issue. This took an entire day. The hallways were a bit noisy and with any hotel, get a room away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MItravelerforbus
Reviews.Content: I appreciate so much about this hotel. The service is great. The rooms are clean. The location is close to the airport, but still in a quiet location. I find that the staff will go out of their way to help me with any needs I might have. I tried their restaurant and enjoyed the food as well.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel?? No WiFi and noisy”
Reviews.Author: visitmae
Reviews.Content: Seriously? No WiFi? It's 2012. And it's in the flight path. And hallway noise is incredibly loud -- you can hear doors slamming and people talking on phones or in person And if you're on the pool side of the hotel...last night there were people partying outside at 1am and I could hear every word with my balcony door closed ...if you're a light sleeper, don't stay here. Also the ice machine on my floor is broken. Overall...lame.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: alj5
Reviews.Content: Was stranded in Phoenix last night, and got a great rate ($60). Very comfy bed, very clean, friendly staff, great breakfast buffet, fast airport shuttle. All in all, totally with it for a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff-Facility Needs an Overhaul”
Reviews.Author: Cacheville
Reviews.Content: I live in the Phoenix area and used to stay at this facility eight or ten times a year. Now I only stay here if the price is great. I can't say enough for the desk staff and people in the bar and restaurant. Mike is a great asset to the Rimrock. Shuttle drivers are always courteous and usually on time. That being said, the bathrooms need a redo, the heating and air conditioning seldom maintain a comfortable temperature, even after a visit by the maintenance staff, and the overall room maintenance is not kept current (caulking, paint, scratches and dents, etc.). Maybe other guests will rate it higher than I have, because they didn't stay here three or four years ago, when it was an outstanding property. I sincerely hope that management will spend some money and get this hotel back to where it was.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke alarms!”
Reviews.Author: barneyminnesota
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff were nice. Have stayed there a few times without any issues until this last stay. The smoke alarms went off several times....6 or 7 from 3 a.m through 5 a.m. They couldn't get them to turn off for periods of 10 to 20 minute intervals. No sleep after that.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected....good value!”
Reviews.Author: Trekinalong
Reviews.Content: We arrived late from Philly...took the shuttle bus... which was a short wait after we called. We took advantage of the option to pick up our Hertz rental car at the hotel the next morning. This saved us time when we arrived and money. Make sure to specify hotel pickup. Check in was fast and efficient. Our room was very clean, nice decor, bed was comfy with good linens, bath amenities were a good quality. The layout of the room was spacious. The Rimrock Lounge off the lobby was not only convenient with our late arrival, but turned out to be delicious with fast service. The buffet breakfast at Resnick's the next morning had a lot of choices both hot and cold, a great selection of fresh fruit, a waffle self-making station and our server was superb! This was a one night stay which worked out great for our purpose.....late arrival into Phoenix and early out the next day to start our travels to the Grand Canyon. We were able to start our car rental the next day without going back to the airport, eat good meals on property upon our arrival and departure conveniently. We were delighted, had a great experience and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: docneneng
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were coming in late in the Phoenix area. They have free shuttle service but make sure you have the hotel number because it is not listed as an option at the airport. (Management - this is something that you may want to fix for the convenience of guests) We did not have to wait long, once we got the number. The bar at the lobby area has good food. Tacos are good, I ordered chicken instead of beef. (a tip for the nonred meat eaters) the salsa is a little too spicy for my liking, though. If you are a Hilton Honors member, book a room at the concierge level. The extra money you pay I think is worth it for the free breakfast and drinks/soda. The rooms are nice and clean. Beds comfortable and bathrooms clean with nice toiletries. (not the cheapo generic ones) There is a Hertz rental car option but when you book,make sure you specify to pick up the car at the hotel. It saves a lot of time because you can easily waste an hour if take the shuttle again to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Gift Shop”
Reviews.Author: ArJayDee3
Reviews.Content: I was at a one day conference at the hotel and didn't stay there. I ate at the restaurant and the food was good and the staff was friendly. The gift shop is another story. The proprietor was rude and the prices were outrageous. $3.28 for a 16 oz. bottle of Diet Coke. Avoid the gift shop if you can.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for business travelers... wasted work evening.. NO WIRELESS.”
Reviews.Author: DonBunch
Reviews.Content: I am business traveler and Diamond member. No wifi in rooms... wont be back. Hotel management.. ever hear of ipad... it doesn't plug in. Helloooooooo. Whoever owns the place... take note, wireless is a MUST.

Reviews.Title: “Great steak Tacos! No wi fi in rooms?”
Reviews.Author: Sion-33126
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business and found that the food at the restaurant is really good. The steak tacos are fantastic! My only complaint is that there is no wi fi on the rooms. At the lobby is paid, even for Diamond Members!!

Reviews.Title: “Aging Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is showing its age. Situated next to high voltage power lines. When returning rental vehicle noticed within a mile there were two gentleman clubs. This is an industrial park not an area to walk around. No shopping and restaurants (other than hotel) within walking distance. No complimentary coffee in lobby. Free amenities are few. Tailored for the business crowd with large expense accounts. Close to airport and shuttle was reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Hilton has to offer”
Reviews.Author: europe_tvlr
Reviews.Content: While on a 10 day driving trip in the southwest, we stayed at this hotel on 2 separate occasions for one night each. I wasn't impressed on either stay. Upon arriving, I was given a room on the 4th floor, which is typical because I am HH Gold. However, I typically get the 'welcome Ms. X, thank you for being a gold member, your room is on the executive floor, complimentary breakfast, evening drinks, etc.' Not at this hotel. Nothing. When I called downstairs for the complimentary access code for the internet, I was told I had to pay for it. Um, nope, that's one of the perks I get for choosing Hilton over any other hotel. The front desk assistant would not budge. On our second stay, we arrived around 6pm and were told that they were completely sold out, so no access to the 4th floor. I understand that...sometimes it's not available; however when I see that I was assigned a room on a higher floor only to have it scratched out and given a different room on the 2nd floor, I get irritated. Again, no 'welcome Ms. X' Nothing. Both rooms were acceptable; however the bathrooms need a serious toothbrush scrub. The tile grout was disgusting. The shower head is immovable and the shower curtain is ill-fitting so the floor gets wet and is VERY slippery. Beware, I had a softball size bruise on my knee for about a week after slipping. Aside from the convenient airport location, this hotel has nothing else to offer. I'd pick another great option near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mabbsy
Reviews.Content: We needed somewhere to crash after a long trip across the pond and this place was recommended by TA members. It turned out to be just right. Shuttle picked us up quickly and staff were friendly. The pool was wonderfully refreshing in the 100 degree heat. Didn`t want too much to eat that evening and were too tired to sit in the restaurant (which actually looked very nice). Ordered a chicken sandwich from room service and it was wonderful. (Nothing like the pathetic thing you would get over here!) Definitely recommended and only five minutes from Sky Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Pattig21
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hilton Phoenix Airport was wonderful. I give a special thanks to all three shuttle drivers who were amazingly helpful. Accomodations were very nice, clean and comfortable. The only draw back is the charge to use wifi and the in room movie charge of $17.00. Would definitely stay again though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Amenities, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrottingPanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton property for one night on our way out of Arizona after a wedding. We picked the location because they offer a free airport shuttle and were close by (we had a super early flight out the day after check-in). The staff were very friendly, they were able to accommodate a last minute request for a room with 2 beds, versus the 1 king bed we had booked with no issues. The price was excellent, just over $100 for the room after tax, and the concierge level floor was very good, they had great appetizers, happy hour priced drinks and free softdrinks. The room we had was very clean, and was a fine size. The bathroom was a bit small but also very clean with good amenities. It wasn't anything extraordinary however for the price I was very pleased. The restaurant on site was good, fairly quick service decent prices and good food. The pool area was very well kept, pool towels were well stocked and the ground are large enough that its not crowded. If a person was staying here as a tourist to see the area, I don't know if it would be the best location just for getting around, but if you had a car it would be fine! For the price and the location as well as the services, I was very impressed. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acgardiner
Reviews.Content: After staying at a number of Hampton Inns throughout our Arizona=New Mexico holiday, we terminated by staying our last night at this hotel. The service has been good, the location excellent and we have not complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for stop over”
Reviews.Author: robeth_8
Reviews.Content: Only stayed overnight for stopover before going to Sedona via Old Town Scottsdale. Had stayed before & reckon the addition of new bar/restaurant since last visit has been well worth it. Staff were very friendly throughout the hotel. Rooms spacious & clean, granted it was the executive floor we stayed on. Only room downside was that we felt it was showing signs of age but this may be a bit picky. Rimrock Bar & Grille, as mentioned above being fairly recent, is a definite plus point. Staff were great, food, although usual fayre, was plentiful & very tasty. We had 2 appetizers which were as big as main courses with the squid especially very tasty. Executive lounge was smallish with good buffet breakfast. Shuttle service for airport available, every hour on the hour. Handy for highway. Also has a pool in the middle of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for early flights”
Reviews.Author: KamaainaFromKona
Reviews.Content: For this level of hotel, you can't beat the location. Especially if you have an early morning flight. Shuttle to the airport is very convenient, running every half hour.The pool area is nice, with palm trees all around the pool, and tables perfect for reading or having your happy hour food and drink. The bar has 5 items for $5 each during happy hour. I got the steak tacos and what a deal! 3 delicious tacos, chips, guacamole, sour cream and salsa. Enough for two people! Ask the bartender for the drink special, though. I asked for red wine & the bartender gave me the $7.95 glass instead of the one on special for $5. But, I got the wine "to go" to take to the pool and she poured a very nice serving! Room was clean and comfortable. I would definately stay here again if I have to go to Phoenix again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: ebp03
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Hilton Phoenix Airport: 10 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes from Mill Avenue, south of ASU, where there are plenty of restaurants and shopping. The hotel was exactly what we needed - clean sheets, fresh towels, and the staff was EXTREMELY helpful and friendly! The 24-hour airport shuttle was only minutes away and came to get us right when & where they said they would. In fact, the airport shuttle driver took us later from the hotel to Mill Avenue for free, because we needed to get dinner and didn't have a car. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"WiFi available" is not always what it seems”
Reviews.Author: D_Gillespie
Reviews.Content: I had a short business trip to Phoenix and booked my room at the Hilton Phoenix Airport noticing that their property description included "WiFi available". Got to Phoenix, had my meetings and went to the hotel to check in. Simple straight forward, no problems. Got to my very nice, very large room and decided to write up notes from my meeting before heading out for dinner. I didn't take my laptop, per usual, instead went with the much smaller, much lighter iPad. For such a short trip I really wouldn't need the laptop and the iPad 2 is a very capable business tool. Well, I quickly discovered what WiFi available really meant. It meant it was available in the bar, restaurant, and lobby. A call to the front desk confirmed there was no in room WiFi, but they were would have it installed in a few more months. A little late for my trip. They went on to suggest I try and connect to other hotels across the parking lot who had free WiFi. Seriously, a Hilton employee suggested I try and leach from another hotel. I also found out that in room wired internet was $9.95 per night. I will tell you that a letter to Hilton was answered promptly and my internet charge was refunded (thanks for that, I guess) and they hoped I would return on my next visit. Hmmmm I'll get back to you on that one Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path from PHX”
Reviews.Author: shlevine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a horrible trip: going to see a client and get my a** kicked. So my mood was already glum. I arrived with two colleagues from FL at 9:06 am on a weekday. I'd called ahead and was told we'd probably be able to get rooms around 10am even though check-in is usually in the afternoon. My directions from the car rental center were wrong, so I went out of the way. But even without that snafu, this hotel seems a little far from the airport--well, specifically, from the rental car center. It doesn't feel like an airport hotel, as it's situated in a little office park and you drive by some really grim areas filled with stripper shacks to get there. So location merits a D. That said, the front desk clerk very helpfully got us three rooms even though it was only about 10am. (Note the huge, electric blue asparagus stalks in the lobby--weird.) My room was a good five-minute walk from the elevator, which is ridiculously far, so be careful when reserving. The room itself was generic Hilton, albeit with a southwestern flair. I was pleased that the a/c blew very cold, and surprised to find a little balcony off the room that overlooked the pool. I was gone all afternoon and had a 7am flight out the next day, so I didn't check out the gym or the pool or any other amenities. We did have dinner in the hotel restaurant and it was surprisingly good and, as I recall, not overly expensive. Parking, as you'd expect, is free. Another colleague joined us and took the free shuttle, which he said was fine and timely. All in all, it's a perfectly acceptable property, but it doesn't feel all that close to the airport, and I can't imagine why anyone would stay in this part of Phoenix unless s/he had an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - clean with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: JohnelnWeldon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hilton Phoenix Airport for two nights. The hotel is very close to the airport so that was very handy after a long flight. The hotel is very clean with good facilities and very friendly staff. The pool was a very nice place to cool down in the desert heat. We got a wonderful deal of approx €40 per room per night which for a hotel of this class is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: drbench400
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before a flight out of PHX. The room was fine as were the amenities in the room. However, the staff at the desk did not tell us about any of the hotel amenities (pool, work-out room) or that WiFi would be $9.95 a day. In the room I looked at the hotel info and nothing mentioned a pool. Well, come the evening when we were headed out we saw that there was a pool. Disappointing... Also, the WiFi connection was poor and these days I am used to free WiFi at most better hotels (including Hampton Inns, a sister Hilton hotel). If I were to stay near the aiport I would choose a different hotel with free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay, just like I expected of a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: FromFirstState
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an impressive lobby. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a great room with great beds. We could not be more pleased with our stay. Our only disappointment is there is no indoor pool. Hotel has an outdoor pool. Pheonix weather is hot and sunny. It would be better to have an indoor pool. There is no restaurants that were close. We did not want to eat at over priced hotel restaurant. We had to drive some distance before we find any restaurant. There is no free internet. Hotel charges $10/day for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Hebridian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Waited 50 minutes for free shuttle which never arrived. We ended up paying for s taxi to the hotel. Check in staff scruffy & unfriendly. We requested them to refund our cab fare which they agreed to. However this didn't happen & an unhelpful & rude manager called Kirsten declined to assist the following morning. There is clear lack of communication between the staff & their customer service towards their Hhonors members is poor. Rooms fine - basic but clean

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ecoconnie
Reviews.Content: I had to cancel my pre-paid reservation due to being hospitalized, I sent in the required papers to get reimbursed, have not had any contact with them since I did this. I rebooked my reservation with them again this was a stopover going to Hawaii, one night and on the trip back we were going to stay 3 nights. The one night stay was terrible , the internet would not work in my room , went to front desk about problem they told me to go to the lounge, which would be ok but I had my granddaughter with me and a lounge at night was no place for children. I went outside and worked which in phoenix was let’s say hot. The noise level was very loud and someone kept banging on our door. We got up early and went to airport just to get out of hotel. I decided not to stay there on our return trip and went to say at the Marriott Courtyard which was lovely. I was contacted by a manager at Hilton and that is the last time I have had contact with anyone. I canceled my Hilton Honors card and also my cc.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job of an airport hotel well but nothing out of this world”
Reviews.Author: Ascottowers
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel though the shuttle to and from the airport is a bit hit and miss given the sheer number of folks who want to take it, the fact that it only runs twice an hour and that the alternative involves a $16 cab ride (minimum fare to and from the airport - what a rip-off). I stayed in a room far away from the registration desk which I didn't mind given the peace and quiet that it afforded me, plus the four minute walk did me good. The room was ok; nice bed, workspace and TV but alas with the tiniest bathroom you have ever seen. I managed to use it ok but it did feel cramped. Dinner at the restaurant was nice and the servers smiled continually throughout their service. The bar serves a great margarita, too. The gym on the ground floor, while not huge, did the job well and was not too busy at 6am. The executive floor lounge serves an OK breakfast. Unfortunately, it offers lots of processed food, but also fresh coffee and a nice fruit platter (though it does take a while to get replenished, so be quick!). I didn't have time to use the pool, but should I return, I will do next time. In all, it is a good hotel that serves the Sky Harbor PHX hotel well. I would just question whether it is worthy of a Hilton status and should be rebranded as a Hilton Garden Inn.

Reviews.Title: “We just couldn't handle the painful shower, otherwise excellent”
Reviews.Author: IrishKelly57
Reviews.Content: If you have sensitive skin or are picky about your shower, you need to read this. My sons and I stayed here one night in order to catch a VERY early flight to Denver. The property itself was beautiful and the room was clean and the beds comfortable. My only complaint was the shower - I have never stayed at a hotel (high or low end) with a showerhead that could not be adjusted. The water came out HARD, like needles impaling your skin. Both my sons and I have VERY sensitive skin, and the shower was literally painful for us. The intensity of the stream could not be turned down - just the temperature. Not to mention, five minutes into the shower, you were standing in six inches of water because the tub didn't drain. it was the most miserable shower experience we have ever had. My son was also disappointed with the wireless internet - he could not connect in the room, and the only "hot spot" in the hotel was a small area close to the bar downstairs. If you wanted to use the hotel business center, the internet access was not free. However, you can print your boarding passes for free, which was great. Upon checkout, I mentioned all this to the clerk, who was VERY kind. She apologized and said she was not familiar with the showerheads, but she would send Engineering to the room to check it out and to fix the drain. She also said when we stayed there on our return from Denver, she would comp us our breakfasts or give us a suite if one was available. I appreciated her empathetic attitude and the time she took to place several notes on our stay, and she placed notes on our future reservation as well. Upon our return, we were comp'd our breakfasts the next day. We went to the room and before unpacking, I immediately turned on the water to see if the tub and sink drained. They did - however the shower was the same. This time, I literally stood on the side of the tub and examined the showerhead. There was no way to turn down or adjust anything. I called the front desk, briefly repeated our issue from a week ago, and the clerk said he would send Engineering to show how to work the shower. We waited for a little over ten minutes, and the phone rang. It was the manager, who apologized and explained there was no way to adjust the shower stream. I told him I was sorry, but we could not stay here. What made this even more unsettling was the fact it was now close to 11:00 at night and we were exhausted from our trip. The Hilton staff were very understanding, and I was sorry we could not stay. Unfortunately, I booked both nights here with Priceline, so I do not expect a refund for the night we did not stay.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and we will return!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel4931
Reviews.Content: This property is very close to Skyharbor Airport. the shuttle was there to pick me up in a matter of minutes. The driver was very courteous and safe. The hotel is out of way, but I liked that! It was very quiet! I enjoyed opening my balcony sliding door and listening to the birds every morning! Check in was a breeze and the desk associate was very helpful in finding a great room location. We were there with two teenagers and they loved the pool! It was very clean and the staff kept it well supplied with water and fresh towel! This property is close to the major freeways, and makes it very easy to get around the Phoenix/Tempe area. The only negative I can say is that we left our rooms late one day (about 11am) to go to Chase Field for a baseball game. When we returned that night, neither of our two rooms had been cleaned. The wifi was good, but at $10 a day, I think was a little expensive. We only used it a few hours a day. I think I will get a mifi for future trips! All in all we enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan
Reviews.Content: REALLY liked this place. Customer service was top-notch. From the shuttle driver who briefed me on the property on the way over, to the check-in desk agent who offered a bottle of water while I was being checked in...and especially to the attendant in the concierge lounge on Saturday evening who was very friendly and helpful. Great staff all around. Clean, comfortable room. OK, maybe a chair on the balcony would have been nice. But otherwise a great room. (Room 260). Steak tacos at the bar and a couple of local beers hit the spot. Bartender was pleasant enough and the prices very reasonable I thought. Can't imagine a negative about the place other than regretting I was only on the property for 12 hours. Next time I'll have to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Full Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZ88
Reviews.Content: Room type was a Junior Suite w/king bed. Very spacious room. Well furnished with attractive decor with subtle southwest flair. Plenty of seating. Larger bathroom with separate tiled stall shower and large, oval jetted tub. Granite vanity with expansive mirror above. Granite wet bar w/refrigerator and coffee maker. Large, well lit work desk. Furnished balcony. Adequate fitness center. Comfortable Hhonors Club Room with good selection of food and beverages offered. Well stocked gift/sundries shop. Hotel staff very friendly....was even greeted by housekeeping in the hallway, "Welcome to the Hilton". The was an overcharge error of the room rate which was corrected immediately. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience for a Hilton Diamond Member”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: I just finished staying 2 nights at this property and I'm a Hilton Diamond member. I was "upgraded" to their 4th floor "executive level". Upon entering my room, I find the previous guests' hairs all over the bathroom floor, inside the bath tub and on the shower walls. Urine and cleaning chemical stains were all over the toilet and heavy dust on all the air vents and furniture. Housekeeping didn't leave a "do not disturb sign" when they finished the room, so a housekeeper tried opening my door without knocking at 8:00am on my 2nd day there. I had to tell her my room was occupied as I was staying 2 nights. I'm just appalled that Hilton hasn't provied adequate training for their staff, especially in this situation with regards to housekeeping. The restaurant had good food and great service, but the rooms are in desperate need ot help. I won't be returning to this property at all anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: 13B4D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always begin and end our stay in the Phoenix-Tucson area at the Hilton Airport, where we are also able to rent a car without the exorbitant costs associated with airport rentals. The staff is friendly and helpful, especially Ms. Heaton, who seems to always be working and who took very good care of us on our last three trips to the area. She is a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Bed Bugs and Poor Management!”
Reviews.Author: ProTravel76
Reviews.Content: This is the first negative review I've ever given a Hilton hotel. Also, I very frequently stay at Hilton Brand Hotels, and I've been a Hilton Gold member for over five years. That said, my most recent experience at this Hilton has made me never want to stay at another Hilton hotel again. My wife and I stayed her in Mid-March 2011, and it would have been an OK stay, except for the fact that I woke up with 50-60 bed bug bites all over my hands, feet, arms and legs. After a day of intense itching and swelling, I visited a doctor who identified the bites as bed bug bites. I also found out that I was allergic to the bites, and the doctor had to be put on prednisone and topical steroids to treat the swelling. After my wife and I got back from the Doctor, we called the hotel to report that I had been bitten by bed bugs. I wasn't calling to get any type of compensation; I was just trying to make them aware of the problem so they could address it. My hopes were that they could prevent other customers from being bitten and help prevent the further spread of these pests. When I finally was able to reach the manager, he was belligerent, rude, and inferred that I was making the entire thing up. There was no, I'm sorry to hear you were bitten, or is there anything we can do for you. Instead, he said, that the person that stayed the day after I did didn't complain about bites, and if I wanted to file a claim that I needed to contact their insurance company. I explained that I didn't want to file a claim, and that I just wanted to make sure that the issue was being taken seriously. From there the manager just became more belligerent and haughty, so I finally just gave up talking to him. Bed Bugs are becoming more and more common, and it the attitudes, apathy, and ineffectiveness of manager's like this that allows continued rapid spread. If this Hilton continues to treat all cases of bed bugs like they did my case, it will be overrun in a matter of weeks. I would strongly recommend avoiding this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Step Inside - You'll Never Believe this is an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: I_Notice_Everything
Reviews.Content: This airport Hilton is beautiful. Gorgeous lobby design, relaxing and spacious restaurants with excellent food, snappy and friendly service all around, and exceptionally quiet. I never expected an airport hotel to feel like a resort. Our professional group booked the Hilton for a conference so everyone could fly in and shuttle to the hotel. It worked out beautifully. I hope we come here again. The only thing I didn't like -- the hotel charges $9 per day for internet service, and I think that's wrong."

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - No Worries From A Frequent Traveller”
Reviews.Author: ccorson97
Reviews.Content: I am a HHonors Diamond and travel quite frequently for my job. I have a client in Tempe and always stay at this hotel when working there. I have found the staff to be VERY friendly and helpful, and have NEVER had an issue with my room - cleanliness or otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Hilton”
Reviews.Author: BR58
Reviews.Content: This stay was last minute due to flight changes, but NEVER again will we stay at a Hilton. At over $200/night, this was the dirtiest, most unprofessional and shoddiest hotel we could have selected and did so only due to its web site and proximity to the airport. The ice machines were filthy and do not work, the room smelled, the furniture is cheap and old and all the housekeeper did was give us air freshener and said ' spray in your room'. The room keys do not open the security access doors to the grounds and they charge $10/day for internet. In the hall ways extra tables and chairs are stored . After four trips to the front desk we had had it. Called Hilton Customer service, filed a complaint and 30 min later someone did call to address our issues. Eventually we settled on 1/2 price for the room, but want to ensure other travelers are aware of this dump. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and dirty rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler053
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation at this hotel for 4 nights. When I arrived they calmed not to have a reservation for me. I gave them the confirmation number and they asked me to wait. A few minutes later they told me that they found my reservation but that the room had been given to someone else. I am Diamond Hilton Honors member and should have been up graded to a better room but instead they put in a room that was the smallest they had. Moreover it had been poorly serviced, was dirty and smelled bad. I was exhausted and slept in the room but the next morning I complained about the room. I was basically told that there was nothing they were going to do about the condition of my room, and nothing they would do about having given my original room to someone else. I knew this had happened because when they gave me the key in the little folders they use that had my name on it, the room had been scratched out and the dirty one substituted. I told them this was unacceptable and asked to speak with the manager. I was told the manager was in a meeting and could not be disturbed. That was the last straw so to speak and I told them I was checking out. The final kicker was the fact that they went ahead and charged the full four day stay on my credit card. I have filed a complaint with the credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: marsabez
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in this hotel after a Hotwire bid of $55. The place is in a shady area of town but if you need to go to the airport early (like we did), its location is very convenient. It is only 10 minutes from terminal and a free shuttle bus takes you there every 30 minutes 24/07. The rooms are beautiful, well maintained and I highly recommend the bar

Reviews.Title: “Great if easier to transfer from airport”
Reviews.Author: janetp48
Reviews.Content: Expensive but nice and comfortable, close to airport. Free phones for hotel transfers at airport do not list hotel so have to use your own phone. Our phones battery was flat and we had to persuade someone to ring for us!!! Very efficient transfer back to airport. Restuarant food (both dinner and breakfast) was good, service efficient,

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with Surpisingly Good Amenities”
Reviews.Author: SuperSnob
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel just as an easy way to get to the airport for an early flight out of Phoenix after my trip to Sedona. I got a seriously low rate on a King suite directly though the Hilton.com website. NOTE: This hotel, while close, is still about a 15-20 minute drive to the airport in the heavy Phoenix morning traffic so please plan accordingly. My first impressions weren't very good for this hotel. It's a large, but older Hilton property and there was construction underway on the parking lot. This (along with the lack of clearly marked signs) made it difficult to even find the entrance to the lobby. Then, since the main lot was closed for construction, I had to park on the back of the building and walk (in the 100 degree Arizona heat). BUT...once inside I was stunned and pleased to find a very nice, two-story atrium lobby complete with shops and a restaurant. The King suite was clean and big---almost the size of a one bedroom apartment. The bathroom was huge with double sinks on a sprawling u-shaped marble vanity and a separate tub and shower. Room service was fast and tasty. I was delighted to find that the pool and hot tub are open 24-hours a day and require a guest key to get in for added security. The pool area was large, nice, and very clean with a nice music selection playing and the hot tub made for a relaxing late night experience (although the water needed to be hotter). Overall, this hotel is a great value for the money. The main drawback is that it's big and old, so everything from the building entrances to the decor in the rooms and throughout the hotel needs to be renovated and updated to give it that modern, classy feel I've come to expect from Hilton. Also, my complaint here as for every other Hilton I've stayed in---WiFi should be free, but sadly, it isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: flygrl444
Reviews.Content: I flew into Phoenix and had a terrible time getting ahold of this hotel to send it's shuttle. What kind of airport location doesn't have a phone at baggage claim?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyeKeiko
Reviews.Content: I missed my flight, and this is the hotel our airlines recommended. We called the complimentary shuttle and he arrived in less than 15 minutes, and he was super friendly and helpful. Check in was quick and easy and the room was awesome for only $60 a night. Wifi should be free though ^_^

Reviews.Title: “Stay away. Dishonest hotel with bad room to make things worse.”
Reviews.Author: 123DFW
Reviews.Content: Our flight was canceled so got a airline voucher to pay for a room at the Hilton and had a confirmed reservation made by American Airlines. Upon getting to the hotel, they accepted the voucher and I verified there would be no charge. Upon receipt of the bill they charged my credit card (which they "had to take" for incidentals) for the room rate. When I protested the charge and told them I was assured by the front desk that there would be no charge, I was told " She was wrong". When I protested further and asked why they would take the voucher if they wouldn't honor it, I was told: She shouldn't have. Called for the manager: She won't return my call. Dishonest and reprehensible. Regarding the room: neither phone worked and had problems with the tv. Called to the front desk who sent an engineer: Neither problems were fixed and no follow up. Asked to change rooms and no response or follow up. Finally went to bed. By the way, I am a silver Honors member. If this is how they treat one of there best clients, can't imagine how they will treat you. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: g1000_8
Reviews.Content: i would recomend staying at this hotel.my wife and i have stayed several times.the staff is very good and the food is good.the rooms are good too. I will be returning this year in october.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texas06
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel courtesy of US Airways since we missed the connection. The hotel was a pleasant surprise. It is clean and well maintained. The lobby area is nice as are the restaurants. The room was spacious and clean with a balcony overlooking the pool. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We had dinner at the restaurant and a buffet breakfast the next morning. Both were good. I would recommend this hotel if you need to spend a night near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: showlowdoc
Reviews.Content: We took our kids for spring break. The hotel was well kept, the front desk folks were friendly and helpful. We had a very relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MFLetou
Reviews.Content: Oddly situated airport hotel. Basically in an industrial park about 8-10 minutes from the airport. The ONLY airport hotel that does not appear to have a courtesy phone in the lobby--annoying--you have to call the hotel directly to get the grumpy shuttle driver to appear. A very poor system requiring you to find the reservation. The hotel itself is fine. Its clearly an older property, only 3-4 stories but spread out. The restaurant is pleasantly situation in an interior courtyard with both indoor and outdoor seating. Breakfast there was fine. The room was average--newer fixtures, LCD TV, carpet was okay. Wallpaper looked older. Very thin comforter, standard Hilton amenities. Sound insulation was worse than average, at least in terms of hearing other doors. Starting at about 6 AM, it was a block party out there--you could heard all sorts of banging around. Overpriced, at least when I stayed. I wasn't aware there was an Airport Marriott, but there is and it looked much newer--I'd try that first. That said, this hotel was fine--not great, not terrible. Charging for internet access in the business center is kind of cheap--Marriott does not do this.

Reviews.Title: “Conference”
Reviews.Author: kaisarhe
Reviews.Content: Enough good things cannot be said about this hotel!!!! Except that the hot tub was out of service while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and clean, but pricey internet”
Reviews.Author: RReed
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 5-10 minutes from the airport, and runs a 24-hour shuttle. The hotel is clean and quiet, and is a typical business hotel. The room was clean, had a large flat-screen tv, and plenty of parking. The check-in and airport driving staff were friendly and personable, and seemed to enjoy working there. My one complaint is that the internet was quite expensive, at about 10 dollars per 24 hours. Considering the Mariott properties next door (Fairfield and Courtyard) don't charge extra for their internet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: SubPsyche
Reviews.Content: The staff was outstanding. They were efficient, friendly and treated my wife and I with an extraordinary kindness and professionalism. The room and hotel was clean and everything was in working order. The housekeeping was clean and quick, the rides to and from the airport were on time and comfortable, and the hotel management went out of their way to create just the right environment for the conference we attended at this hotel. Thank you Hilton Airport for an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fine Airport Stop”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: This was a fine stop before an early morning flight. Only caution is that the hotel is still about six miles from the rental car area and it will not be the easiest hotel to find without a GPS. Staff was efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean/ not working Bathroom-Unprofessional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: italygreece
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a night in Dec 2009. Had a late check in, dropped luggage and wen to meet friends. Came back at 2:30 AM to notice the toilet flooded after flushing, and the bath tub was covered in some kind of black stuff. Ran to the phone to call the front desk to realise the phone was not working. While the toilet flooding , now seeped in to the room, put my jacket over my PJs ran downstairs to inform the front desk about flooding. They immediately put me in a another room, but so far not a single apology from Hilton after numerous customer reviews. Very unprofessional of Hilton to keep dirty bathrooms, not working phones and worst customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: natalya1299
Reviews.Content: My trip to the Hilton Phoenix Airport was in a capcity as the meeting organizer for the first time. The Sales Team there was incredibly flexible to our every need and change and were very understanding that I had never acted in a organizer role before. Every detail of the meeting including rooms, equiment, and meals, were carried out just as planned. In fact, our VP that attended the meeting stood up at the end of the meeting and made a call to action to all participants to consider this hotel when planning our next event. As a side note, he did not do that at other hotel meetings that he attended for the same project. But for the standard hotel review information, the hotel is located about 5 miles from the airport and they do offer a shuttle. There are restaurants on site, but not many outside that area. It is a 20 minute drive to Scottsdale where there are a tremendous amount of accomodations for eating, shopping etc. The check-in process was seamless and I was provided with recognition of my meeting organizer role and was treated well. The rooms were well equipped with soft beds and modern appliances and tvs. The only negative is that they segregate/name the floors based on point level. Although I was at the hotel in a meeting organizer capacity, I was put on the silver level floor, which was nice. However, the more elite HiltonHonors members were put on the 4th floor that included a full breakfast. It would've been nicer to not name the floors in the elevator, but just make note to the hotel guests of the extra ammenitites so that others would not feel slighted when they get in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis near the airport”
Reviews.Author: EdCo
Reviews.Content: Since family members moved to the Phoenix area I have found myself making the trek from Chicago on holidays and, occasionally, just for the break. My flights out of Chicago usually bring me in later than I care to disturb family so my routine has been to find an airport hotel to relax for the evening. The Hilton Phoenix Airport is the perfect oasis near the airport. Comfortable, large, well appointed rooms with friendly staff from the shuttle bus drivers, front desk staff, and the bartenders and waiters/waitresses in the reasonably priced restaurant. The hotel has a nice courtyard pool and is nicely quiet. I have always found this hotel to be a good value for the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: Minivandriver
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in order to catch an early flight out of Sky Harbor. Location is very convenient to airport, but in remote office park area, adjacent to seedy neighborhood of junk yards and gentlemen's clubs. Need to drive a couple miles if you want to dine outside the hotel restaurant. Shuttle drivers were super nice and professional, picking me up both in the evening after dropping my rental car, and getting my family to the terminal in the pre-dawn hours. Room service food was good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel-No Way”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the Phoenix airport as it is about a mile from the terminal. It has shuttle service. I write only as a frequent business travelor and a Hilton Platinum with some minimal expectations of a hotel that sells itself as business friendly. My biggest beef is when a business hotel has a marginal, at best, internet. When checking in I specifically asked for a wireless room and was told that it may or may not work. It didn't. So, I am now hooked in at the desk and the cable connection is as slow as molasses. I simply could not do my work. So, I end up looking for a Starbucks. It is inexcusable in todays world for a hotel not to have a top of the line internet connection. One more note. Although I was on the 4th floor for Honor's Members only one ice machine worked and every time I tried to get ice I got dirt...lots of it...in my ice. I finally gave up. If you have to stay by the airport and you don't want to put up with the hassles at this hotel there are several alternatives in the neighborhood. Come on Hilton get it right or get out of the business hotel arena.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like a comfortable bed, great service and great food!”
Reviews.Author: musttravel26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling to Hawaii and had an overnight stay here. My husband who has cancer fell ill during the night and was admitted to the hospital. We had to keep our room here for 4 days while he was sick. The staff in the hotel and restaurant were so kind and accommodating I couldn't thank them enough. The beds are like sleeping in a cloud, rooms were large and clean and I never had anything but delicious meals in the restaurant (great service there too). There are parts of the hotel that are dated (which they are refurbishing) but I would rather have all of the above than perfect decor. I would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprize”
Reviews.Author: cracklehillhogg
Reviews.Content: Starting a vacation and finding that you haven't actually booked your first hotel is a shock, believe me. No problem, the hotel and the guy on reception were fantastic. . I recommend the breakfast too. If these people are typical of those in Arizona, you are to be congratulated

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: damatam
Reviews.Content: We were given a room here by American Airlines after our flight was canceled and we couldn't get another flight until the next day. Our room was on the first floor and we had direct access to the inside courtyard pool. The staff were very friendly and gave us free coupons for their breakfast buffet. The southwestern decor seemed a little dated, but, overall, we were impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice after long flight from UK.”
Reviews.Author: BCATAH
Reviews.Content: We got shuttle bus from airport to hotel at 6.30 pm after a long flight from the UK Although others would not agree,we had a satisfactory experience.The plus point for us was that we could could get a meal on site as we did not pick up our hire car till the next day. We got a meal in the bar which was fine and got the shuttle at 5.30 am the next day to the terminal. We obviously did not use the business facilities,but the hotel met our needs perfectly adequately.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent one night stop”
Reviews.Author: wadewade
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 7th May having arrived from UK at 6pm. We wanted an efficient free shuttle service and a restaurant on site and got both here courtesy of a booking through Hotwire. I think the previous two postings must have been very unlucky. We found everything satisfactory. We had a meal in the bar. The salmon salad was very good and enormous - enough for two. Morning shuttle was also very good - we were going to the Car Rental Facility and the hotel driver dropped us at a terminal where we just walked across the pavement to a waiting airport shuttle bus (free).

Reviews.Title: “I would avoid”
Reviews.Author: bobdobilina
Reviews.Content: So i am a long time lurker at tripadvisor, and was so unimpressed with this hotel I decided to log in to share my experience (i will definitely post positive reviews of other hotels in the future). One proviso - when i went to use the automatic kiosk to check in it printed out a form to take to the front desk saying "hotel sold out"... so it's my guess they are needing to assign their worse rooms. Also, i am paying $220+ for business and it looks like some people pay approx. $50 through hotwire - although by my experience i wouldn't even stay at that. To keep the review fairly short i'll just list the issues in bullets: - The room (366) absolutely stinks of stale smoke - it must have once been a smoking room - Most of the buttons on the phone do not appear to work: busy for room service (tried 5 times), no answer to wake up call, does not even dial for operator - Condition of room is very shabby, carpet is old and coming off the grounds, general cleaniness is very bad (not a cleaning issue, more an age issue) - Television system somewhat faulty (there is a channel that scrolls though the porn offerings (does not actually show the movies) which be an issue for some people with kids - Wirless internet signal is to weak to use (at least in my room) On the positive side, room service was on time and fairly decent, and they gave you 2 bottles of cold water on arrival. Overall this is the worse Hilton (or Garden Inn) i have stayed in (I have stayed in many)... some other people seem to have had positive experiences but I just thought it prudent to add a word of caution.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Husker4theSpurs
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was perfect for what we were looking for ... clean, convenient location, and great price on Priceline ... front desk lady was really helpful as well!! Probably the best value I've ever received on Priceline for the money ($38 bid).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night. I chose the location because it was fairly close to the museums in Phoenix we wanted to go to and close to the freeway when it was time to leave. The room was attractive, comfortable and well appointed. A two cup coffee maker made some of the best coffee we had tasted during our entire trip. The pool was heated and the spa was hot. The beds were extremely comfortable. The staff superb. There isn‘t much around the hotel except for 2 other hotels. We drove to the hotel from the 10 East and saw quite a few auto body shops and a strip club along the way, but you can’t expect to find nice homes near and airport. The nearest restaurants seem to be about 2 miles away from the hotel. The hotel has a restaurant but we didn’t eat there. I would have no problems with staying here again, we received a nice price on hotwire or priceline. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton Option Near Tempe”
Reviews.Author: ccorson97
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights for business. The location is very close to the hotel (about 5-10 minutes from the PHX Car Rental) and close to I-10. I was working in Tempe, and this was the best option. I am an HHonors Gold member and was upgraded to a 1-bedroom suite. There was a separate living area with bar, fridge, etc and a normal size hotel bedroom. In addition, the bathroom was HUGE. Double vanity sink, separate huge stand-in shower, and jacuzzi tub. The hotel food was very reasonably priced for a Hilton. Arizona has smoking hotel rooms, so avoid those floors when possible. The first floor had a huge smoking smell, but that's not the hotel's fault. Overall, a great option if you need to be close to Tempe or the airport.

Reviews.Title: “close to the airport, free internet”
Reviews.Author: htsec
Reviews.Content: I spent just one night at this hotel (drove to Grand Canyon the next day). Arrived by plane at 11 PM, and called the hotel shuttle, that didn't take long. The car I reserved at Hertz was already waiting for me, and the check-in was quick and easy. The room was great, comfy bed and the internet was free at the business center. Very good service. Great option near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Quality (And cheap if you find the right price) Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertGehl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night in January 2009. By looking at the other reviews, we booked with Hotwire (If you pick the Airport area, they have an unnamed 3-star hotel in the area, that's likely the Airport Hilton) and paid less than $55 (with taxes and fees). PROS: Quality restaurant (Rennick's) on-site. Very good food. Extraordinarily comfortable beds. Down comforter ... very nice. Staff is trained to be extra nice ... but not too smarmy. There's a grill + sports bar on site. We didn't go in, but having one there is a plus, considering one of the "cons" Price: Again ... this is a 3-star hotel that we booked for cheap. Their normal going rate is over $100. HUGE, puffy towels ... very nice. MP3 player plugin on clock radio ... CONS: Location. This area is rife with strip clubs and auto-body shops. There's ZERO to do/see within a couple miles. Downtown Tempe is several miles east, so that's the best bet. It's also kind of out of the way, on the SE side of the airport. High-Speed Internet: They charge $9.95 for access ... with 1- and 2-star hotels offering it for free, it's time this place does the same. Decor: Yes, it's supposed to be a Southwestern motif, but it's a little old and worn. Time for a remodel. TV: The remote looked like it went through a dryer ... And some of the "buttons" didn't work. The TV itself was an old, fuzzy Zenith. That needs updating too. CONCLUSION: Excellent hotel for the price, but ONLY for the price. This is NOT a $120 per night hotel. If you pay less than 60-70 though, you'll be thrilled.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: holydoodle
Reviews.Content: One night stay on Dec. 31st and it was a very memorable evening, We would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: 1LifeisaJourney
Reviews.Content: I usually don't expect much from Airport Hotels - but I expect more than this. None of the business center computers worked the entire time of my stay - I even called ahead to ensure they had them so I could check work email without lugging my work laptop with me. I kept putting my Do Not Disturb sign on the door, and EVERY morning the cleaning staff would knock on the door to see if I wanted service???? Nothing to eat after 10 pm - so if you have a late flight like I did, bring your own dinner. Don't bother looking in the book in the room...it is VERY outdated. Ordered room service - it was the wrong order and no silverware was on the tray. Breakfast staff was rude and it took over 20 minutes to order. They gave me written directions to return a rental car to the airport - the directions were wrong. What were the postitives? The check-in process was good, the front desk staff was friendly and thankfully I only had to stay 3 nights for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: zan75
Reviews.Content: I booked here as I had a conference to attend at this hotel for 3 days. What a wonderful choice. Check in was fast and courteous. Rooms were clean, spacious and comforatable. Food was outstanding, for both the conference and on my own. Pool was refreshing on the hot days. Overall for the price of this hotel it cannot be beat! I will definitely stay here again conference or not.

Reviews.Title: “above average airport hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Sandokan62
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at this hotel as I have to do some business near by. I was a little bit hesitant the first time i stayed there and planned to have 3 overnights as you "normally" only want to stay max one night at any kind of Airport Hotel. But the Hilton is really a good choice, not the kind of Airport Hotel Experience that you normally have. The bar is good, the staff very friendly, the rooms are nice and the location is pretty calm. Only negative comment: the F&B Manager should look at the Menue of the restaurant. Not really a good idea to have dinner there.... Additonally, you should have a car if you plan to stay there as the taxi services in Phoenix are pretty poor (long waiting time). The shuttle service to the Airport is free with a frequency of 30 minutes. Fair rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hilton Phoenix Airport”
Reviews.Author: MissMoose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I flew into Phoenix at the end of June 2008 and spent the first two nights of our holiday at the Hilton Phoenix Airport. We contacted the hotel via the courtesy phone in the arrivals hall and the mini bus arrived in around 10 minutes. A warm welcome awaited us at check-in, along with two bottles of refreshing water! We booked a king room on the executive floor (which is the fourth and top floor of the hotel). The room was large and also contained a settee, coffee table, desk and chair. There was an in-room safe, coffee maker (teabags also provided), hairdryer, iron and ironing board. Our balcony faced on to the pool area. The room was spotlessly clean and the bed lovely and comfortable. The bathroom was small, but nicely furnished and had a large selection of Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. We did not hear any noise emanating from rooms either side or the hallway. Our package included breakfast and on the second evening we ate in the hotel restaurant (there is also a bar which also serves meals). The food was delicious and the service very good. There are other hotels in the vicinity, which may also serve food, but we were quite happy to eat in the hotel. We had pre-booked a Gray Line tour for the second day - "Valley of the Sun" - and thoroughly enjoyed this. Special thanks here go to our tour guide Charlie, who also picked us up at the hotel and dropped us off again at the end of the tour. The hotel also has a fitness centre, business centre and small gift shop. At the end of our stay we travelled by courtesy transport back to the airport to pick up a rental car and for a nominal $5 charge we were driven directly to the car rental centre. We made our reservation via the Hilton website and consider the rate we paid (particularly in view of the favourable £/$ exchange rate) taking into account the quality of accommodation and delicious breakfast, to represent excellent value for money. We found every member of the hotel staff we came into contact with during our stay to be very friendly and helpful. If we should fly into Phoenix again, we will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Location, Nice Bed”
Reviews.Author: thetravelpro
Reviews.Content: I just returned from two decent nights at this Hilton. The hotel was a big disappointment at first. When I walked in, the lobby was barely cooler than outside (110 degrees.) Checking in was quick, and they gave me a cold bottle of water, but the staff couldn't answer my simple question ("Where can we get a quick dinner around here?") The decor throughout the hotel was old and tired, and the faint odor didn't help. The elevator was completely stuffy, so I chose the stairs after just two tries on the elevator. The room was just like the hallways - old and slightly smelly, but at least the temperature was lower. The bathroom was tiny, but compared to the rest of the hotel, it was beautiful. Everything in the room looked clean, but I didn't dare sit on the couch or the desk chair. The lamp switches were all slightly sticky, and I did my best to ignore that. As with all Hilton hotels nowadays, there were cards with instructions about how to get the sheets and towels changed. Since I was only there for two nights, I ended up putting the do-not-disturb sign out the entire time (no need for housekeeping to come in if they're not going to change my sheets or towels.) Two things made the entire stay a 3 star instead of a 2 star. First, the sheets were completely clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Second, the bathroom was clean, and the water pressure was great. In terms of location, this Hilton is apparently in a weird place.
